che16.dcs.aber.ac.uk.controller

Class ControlPanelListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • che16.dcs.aber.ac.uk.controller.ControlPanelListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class ControlPanelListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This Class is a dedicated ActionListener for the ControlPanel instance.
    Author:
    Christopher Edwards

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Inherited method as a result of the implementing ActionListener interface. This method converts the source of the interaction into a String which is then compared to the element identifiers present in the user interface, if there is a match then the correct action is performed. Any additional ControlPanel elements that need ActionLisetner functionality must be also be implemented in this method.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • lockUI

        public void lockUI()
        This method is used to lock the current user interface elements such that they can no longer be modified. This should only be used when the user in is step-based iteration.

      • unlockUI

        public static void unlockUI()
        This method is used to unlock the current user interface. Once the interface has been locked using the lockUI() method. This method ensures that every user interface element is in fact in and editable state.
